data.text: @savehalfmoonpub @cfz1 Haha was thinking we’ll have to get some of the new Watneys in! Cheers for the research, we’ll be seeing what else we can find.
@sharkmicropub @cfz1 The Athenaeum Public House on Camberwell New Road is also said to have been home to entertainments such as Music Hall in its early years. https://t.co/TPCZamLp2v

@sharkmicropub @cfz1 Looks like it was a Henekey’s pub from 1921, probably up until 1982, when the Henekey’s pub group was sold off. Pubs History website has records of Athenaeum landlords dating back to September 1855. This place has heritage! https://t.co/zpZ9cbXvqt
@sharkmicropub @cfz1 Time to break out the Watneys Red Barrel! 🍺 https://t.co/1O9lvr16Vo

@savehalfmoonpub @cfz1 We’ll have a dig around in the local archives at some point for more information. It was a Watney Combe Reid pub. There’s this mention of it in the Times in 1904. https://t.co/YE9xWSuaq7

@cfz1 @sharkmicropub Records show that the pub was closed in 1996. Managed by Henekey’s Ltd in 1944. Building in within Southwark’s Camberwell Green conservation area, and noted as ‘a key corner building in need of refurbishment.’ https://t.co/wcm9Byg2No
@cfz1 Cheers for the photo. Was gone before our time too, we’re hoping to find out more about it when we get chance.
